column18: 02/01/2015: Assailants opened fire on soldiers outside of the presidential palace in Maseru city, Maseru district, Lesotho. A private security guard was killed and two soldiers serving as guards for the president were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed it to rebels trying to disrupt the election process.
column64: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources suspected that the two soldiers were targeted because they had assisted the prime minister in avoiding a coup attempt in August 2014.
